Please note: spots may be limited in the webinar.[/dfd_heading][dfd_heading subtitle="" enable_delimiter="" undefined="" title_font_options="tag:div|font_size:18|color:%2333d187|font_style_bold:1" subtitle_font_options="tag:h5|color:%23dd3333|line_height:50|font_style_bold:1" tutorials=""]

THIS IS AN ARCHIVE OF A MEETING HELD ON THE DATE ABOVE

SCROLL DOWN FOR PRESENTER'S RECORDING AND SLIDES

screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][dfd_heading subtitle="" delimiter_settings="delimiter_style:solid|delimiter_width:0|delimiter_height:1" undefined="" title_font_options="tag:h4|color:%23000000" subtitle_font_options="tag:h4"]Value In The Age of Growth[/dfd_heading][vc_column_text]Much has been made about the death of active management. Indeed, tech darlings like Amazon and Netflix have powered much of the global equity market's returns in recent years. The goal of the FPA Crescent Fund is to generate equity-like returns over the long-term but take less risk than the stock market. Over more than two decades of investing, FPA Crescent has delivered on its stated goals. But in the face of seemingly infinite money printing, active management's future appears less certain. Join Steve for a dynamic conversation on how to navigate the current economic environment without exposing investor capital to the myriad of risks in today's equity and debt markets.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text]
You will learn...
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][dfd_icon_list module_animation="transition.slideRightBigIn" list_fields="%5B%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22The%20current%20market%20for%20risk%20assets%20around%20the%20world%20is%20expensive%2C%20offering%20little%20margin%20of%20safety%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22What%20you%20don't%20own%20can%20be%20just%20as%20important%20as%20what%20you%20do%20own%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Differentiated%2C%20global%20multi-asset%20strategies%20with%20an%20absolute%20return%20focus%20like%20FPA%20Crescent%20may%20provide%20good%20risk-adjusted%20returns%20over%20full%20market%20cycles%5Cn%22%7D%5D" icon_border="border_style:none|border_color:%2334d288" main_style="style-1" icon_size="20" icon_color="#5e67bb" font_options="tag:h6|color:%2334d288"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][vc_column_text]Steven Romick, CFA is a value investor and has managed the $14 billion FPA Crescent Fund since its inception in 1993. This Fund seeks to generate equity-like returns over the long-term take less risk than the market and avoid permanent impairment of capital. FPA Crescent has provided the best risk-adjusted returns of all allocation mutual funds according to Morningstar. Mr. Romick was awarded Morningstar's U.S. Allocation Fund Manager of the Year (2013) and was a nominee for Morningstar's Manager of the Decade (2009). Mr. Romick began his investment career in 1985 with Kaplan, Nathan & Co. as an analyst. In 1990 he started his own firm, Crescent Management, in order to focus on finding out-of -favor, low risk/high return investments in various parts of the capital markets. Mr. Romick earned a BS in Education from Northwestern University and is a CFA Charter holder.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][dfd_button button_text="Presenter's Webinar col_shadow_hover="box_shadow_enable:disable|shadow_horizontal:0|shadow_vertical:15|shadow_blur:50|shadow_spread:0|box_shadow_color:rgba(0%2C0%2C0%2C0.35)"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][dfd_heading subtitle="" delimiter_settings="delimiter_style:solid|delimiter_width:0|delimiter_height:1" undefined="" title_font_options="tag:h2" subtitle_font_options="tag:div"]What Does the 2020 Election Mean for Your Retirement?[/dfd_heading][vc_column_text]Elections have consequences. This has become a popular phrase in politics over the past few years, but the reality is elections do have consequences for your finances, especially your retirement. With many crucial retirement programs like Social Security, Medicare, and Medicaid experiencing funding issues, reform could be on the way, and the election will impact the direction of reform. The markets like certainty, and uncertainty can create volatility, so where will this election cycle leave the markets? I often describe retirement planning like trying to hit a moving target in the wind. Elections can change the way the wind blows and the course of your retirement plan.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text]
You will learn...
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][dfd_icon_list module_animation="transition.slideRightBigIn" list_fields="%5B%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22How%20could%20the%20markets%20react%20to%20the%20election%20-%20do%20markets%20really%20prefer%20a%20blue%20or%20red%20wave%3F%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22What%20will%20the%20future%20of%20Social%20Security%20look%20like%3F%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Tax%20and%20regulatory%20reform%202.0%20-%20What%20might%20a%20change%20in%20power%20in%20DC%20mean%20for%20tax%20policy%20and%20regulatory%20reforms%3F%22%7D%5D" icon_border="border_style:none|border_color:%2334d288" main_style="style-1" icon_size="20" icon_color="#5e67bb" font_options="tag:h6|color:%2334d288"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][vc_column_text]Jamie Hopkins, Esq., LLM, MBA, CFP, RICP is the managing director of Carson Coaching and the Director of Retirement Research for Carson Group. He is a finance professor of practice at Creighton University's Heider College of Business and is the author of the book: Rewirement: Rewiring The Way You Think About Retirement Planning. Jamie helped co-create the Retirement Income Certified Professional (RICP) designation at The American College of Financial Services. He was named as a top 40 financial service professional under the age of 40 by InvestmentNews. In 2020, his work on retirement planning and the SECURE Act won an award from WealthManagement.com for being the best Thought Leadership Advisor Education in the industry.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer If you have not already made a contribution for this program, 

please consider making a voluntary $10 or $15 donation to

AAII's LA Chapter. To donate online (CLICK HERE) Thank you!

[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/6"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: Financial Education meeting information that focuses on the broad overview of basic individual investing in today's market.
